alert.note: Alert for Letcher; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Harlan, southwestern Letcher and southeastern Perry Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 229 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pine Mountain, or 12 miles northeast of Harlan, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Totz around 235 PM EDT. Gilley, Diane, Louellen, Black Bottom, Lejunior, Closplint and Clover-Darby around 240 PM EDT. Delphia around 245 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Hiram, Gordon, Cumberland, Lynch, Benham, Kingdom Come S.P., Linefork, Blair, Clutts, Defeated Creek, Skyline and Flint. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
